battery.英释: an object that provides a supply of electricity for something such as a radio, car, or toy

compact.英释: packed or put together firmly and closely

chronic.英释: a chronic disease or illness is one that continues for a long time and cannot be cured

suspend.英释: to officially stop something from continuing, especially for a short time

obesity.英释: when someone is very fat in a way that is unhealthy

tuition.英释: the money you pay for being taught

prevail.英释: if a belief, custom, situation etc prevails, it exists among a group of people at a certain time

receipt.英释: a piece of paper that you are given which shows that you have paid for something

typical.英释: having the usual features or qualities of a particular group or thing

outlive.英释: to remain alive after someone else has died

relieve.英释: to reduce someone’s pain or unpleasant feelings

revenue.英释: money that a business or organization receives over a period of time, especially from selling goods or services

calorie.英释: a unit for measuring the amount of energy that food will produce

mention.英释: to talk or write about something or someone, usually quickly and without saying very much or giving details

pattern.英释: the regular way in which something happens, develops, or is done

deposit.英释: a part of the cost of something you are buying that you pay some time before you pay the rest of it

reunion.英释: a social meeting of people who have not met for a long time, especially people who were at school or college together

premium.英释: the cost of insurance, especially the amount that you pay each year

convert.英释: to change something into a different form, or to change something so that it can be used for a different purpose or in a different way

inspire.英释: to encourage someone by making them feel confident and eager to do something

upgrade.英释: to make a computer, machine, or piece of software better and able to do more things

certify.英释: to state that something is correct or true, especially after some kind of test

insurer.英释: a person or company that provides insurance

dolphin.英释: a very intelligent sea animal like a fish with a long grey pointed nose

robbery.英释: the crime of stealing money or things from a bank, shop etc, especially using violence

conduct.英释: to carry out a particular activity or process, especially in order to get information or prove facts

collide.英释: to hit something or someone that is moving in a different direction from you

offense.英释: when you offend or upset someone by something you do or say

endless.英释: very large in amount, size, or number

extreme.英释: very unusual and severe or serious

faculty.英释: all the teachers in a university

portray.英释: to describe or show someone or something in a particular way, according to your opinion of them

consult.英释: to ask for information or advice from someone because it is their job to know something

migrate.英释: if people migrate, they go to live in another area or country, especially in order to find work

embrace.英释: to eagerly accept a new idea, opinion, religion etc

deliver.英释: to take goods, letters, packages etc to a particular place or person

symptom.英释: something wrong with your body or mind which shows that you have a particular illness

species.英释: a group of animals or plants whose members are similar and can breed together to produce young animals or plants

formula.英释: a series of numbers or letters that represent a mathematical or scientific rule

harness.英释: to control and use the natural force or power of something

density.英释: the degree to which an area is filled with people or things

dismiss.英释: to remove someone from their job

testify.英释: to make a formal statement of what is true, especially in a court of law

qualify.英释: to have the right to have or do something, or to give someone this right

imitate.英释: to copy the way someone behaves, speaks, moves etc, especially in order to make people laugh

drought.英释: a long period of dry weather when there is not enough water for plants and animals to live

hostile.英释: angry and deliberately unfriendly towards someone, and ready to argue with them

console.英释: to make someone feel better when they are feeling sad or disappointed

discern.英释: If you can discern something, you are aware of it and know what it is

therapy.英释: the treatment of an illness or injury over a fairly long period of time

payroll.英释: the total amount of wages paid to all the people working in a particular company or industry

unified.英释: created from more than one part, group etc

deprive.英释: If you deprive someone of something that they want or need, you take it away from them, or you prevent them from having it

suspect.英释: someone who is thought to be guilty of a crime

penalty.英释: a punishment for breaking a law, rule, or legal agreement

clarify.英释: to make something clearer or easier to understand

fixture.英释: a piece of equipment that is fixed inside a house or building and is sold as part of the house

welfare.英释: someone’s welfare is their health and happiness

subsidy.英释: money that is paid by a government or organization to make prices lower, reduce the cost of producing goods etc

private.英释: for use by one person or group, not for everyone

tedious.英释: something that is tedious continues for a long time and is not interesting

smuggle.英释: to take something or someone illegally from one country to another

clarity.英释: the clarity of a piece of writing, law, argument etc is its quality of being expressed clearly

enforce.英释: to make something happen or force someone to do something

grocery.英释: a shop/store that sells food and other things used in the home

recruit.英释: to find new people to work in a company, join an organization, do a job etc

neglect.英释: to fail to look after someone or something properly

entitle.英释: to give someone the official right to do or have something

quicken.英释: to become quicker or make something quicker

outcome.英释: the final result of a meeting, discussion, war etc – used especially when no one knows what it will be until it actually happens

dweller.英释: a person or animal that lives in a particular place

pronoun.英释: a word that is used instead of a noun or noun phrase, such as ‘he’ instead of ‘Peter’ or ‘the man’

reverse.英释: the opposite order etc to what is usual or to what has just been stated

provoke.英释: to make someone angry, especially deliberately

texture.英释: the way a surface or material feels when you touch it, especially how smooth or rough it is

portion.英释: a part of something larger, especially a part that is different from the other parts

conquer.英释: to get control of a country by fighting

release.英释: to let someone go free, after having kept them somewhere

program.英释: a series of actions which are designed to achieve something important

utterly.英释: completely – used especially to emphasize that something is very bad, or that a feeling is very strong

genuine.英释: a genuine feeling, desire etc is one that you really feel, not one you pretend to feel

dropout.英释: someone who leaves school or college before they have finished

capture.英释: to catch a person and keep them as a prisoner

elevate.英释: to move someone or something to a more important level or rank, or make them better than before

acutely.英释: feeling or noticing something very strongly

isolate.英释: to separate one person, group, or thing from other people or things

pasture.英释: land or a field that is covered with grass and is used for cattle, sheep etc to feed on

minimal.英释: very small in degree or amount, especially the smallest degree or amount possible

barrier.英释: a rule, problem etc that prevents people from doing something, or limits what they can do

fulfill.英释: if you fulfill a hope, wish, or aim, you achieve the thing that you hoped for, wished for etc

tangled.英释: twisted together in an untidy mass

tragedy.英释: a very sad event, that shocks people because it involves death

lawsuit.英释: a problem or complaint that a person or organization brings to a court of law to be settled

surpass.英释: to be even better or greater than someone or something else

deviate.英释: to change what you are doing so that you are not following an expected plan, idea, or type of behaviour

scandal.英释: an event in which someone, especially someone important, behaves in a bad way that shocks people

confine.英释: to keep someone or something within the limits of a particular activity or subject

indulge.英释: to let someone have or do whatever they want, even if it is bad for them

squalor.英释: the condition of being dirty and unpleasant because of a lack of care or money

awesome.中释: 令人敬畏的,令人赞叹的；极好的
awesome.英释: extremely impressive, serious, or difficult so that you feel great respect, worry, or fear

gesture.英释: a movement of part of your body, especially your hands or head, to show what you mean or how you feel

awkward.英释: making you feel embarrassed so that you are not sure what to do or say

vehicle.英释: a machine with an engine that is used to take people or things from one place to another, such as a car, bus, or truck

deficit.英释: the difference between the amount of something that you have and the higher amount that you need

ancient.英释: belonging to a time long ago in history, especially thousands of years ago

distort.英释: to report something in a way that is not completely true or correct

assault.英释: a military attack to take control of a place controlled by the enemy

inherit.英释: to receive money, property etc from someone after they have died

decline.英释: to say no politely when someone invites you somewhere, offers you something, or wants you to do something

paradox.英释: a statement that seems impossible because it contains two opposing ideas that are both true

cripple.英释: someone who is unable to walk properly because their legs are damaged or injured - now considered offensive

startle.英释: to make someone suddenly surprised or slightly shocked

coastal.英释: in the sea or on the land near the coast

notably.英释: in a way that is clearly different, important, or unusual

exploit.英释: to develop and use minerals, forests, oil etc for business or industry

crucial.英释: something that is crucial is extremely important, because everything else depends on it

trigger.英释: to make something happen very quickly, especially a series of events

justice.英释: fairness in the way people are treated

convict.英释: to prove or officially announce that someone is guilty of a crime after a trial in a law court

vitamin.英释: a chemical substance in food that is necessary for good health

achieve.英释: to successfully complete something or get a good result, especially by working hard

pension.英释: an amount of money paid regularly by the government or company to someone who does not work any more, for example because they have reached the age when people stop working or because they are ill

confess.英释: to admit something that you feel embarrassed about

measure.英释: an action, especially an official one, that is intended to deal with a particular problem

signify.英释: to represent, mean, or be a sign of something

violent.英释: involving actions that are intended to injure or kill people, by hitting them, shooting them etc

anxiety.英释: the feeling of being very worried about something

descent.英释: your family origins, especially your nationality or relationship to someone important who lived a long time ago

reflect.英释: to show the image of sb/sth on the surface of sth such as a mirror, water or glass

seasick.英释: feeling ill when you travel in a boat, because of the movement of the boat in the water

magnify.英释: to make something seem bigger or louder, especially using special equipment

sponsor.英释: a person or company that pays for a show, broadcast, sports event etc, especially in exchange for the right to advertise at that event

present.英释: to give something to someone, for example at a formal or official occasion

overlap.英释: If one thing overlaps another, or if you overlap them, a part of the first thing occupies the same area as a part of the other thing. You can also say that two things overlap.

organic.英释: relating to farming or gardening methods of growing food without using artificial chemicals, or produced or grown by these methods

refrain.英释: to not do something that you want to do

agonize.英释: to think about a difficult decision very carefully and with a lot of effort

promote.英释: If people promote something, they help or encourage it to happen, increase, or spread

worship.英释: to admire and love someone very much

gallery.英释: a large building where people can see famous pieces of art

geology.英释: the study of the rocks, soil etc that make up the Earth, and of the way they have changed since the Earth was formed

costume.英释: a set of clothes worn by an actor or by someone to make them look like something such as an animal, famous person etc

predict.英释: to say that something will happen, before it happens

intense.英释: having a very strong effect or felt very strongly

miracle.英释: something very lucky or very good that happens which you did not expect to happen or did not think was possible

worldly.英释: relating to ordinary life rather than spiritual or religious ideas

literal.英释: the literal meaning of a word or expression is its basic or original meaning

session.英释: a formal meeting or group of meetings, especially of a law court or parliament

capital.英释: relating to money that you use to start a business or to make more money

frankly.英释: used to show that you are saying what you really think about something

appoint.英释: to choose someone for a position or a job

deserve.英释: to have earned something by good or bad actions or behaviour

propose.英释: to suggest something as a plan or course of action

frantic.英释: extremely worried and frightened about a situation, so that you cannot control your feelings

capable.英释: having the qualities or ability needed to do something

virtual.英释: made, done, seen etc on the Internet or on a computer, rather than in the real world

approve.英释: to think that someone or something is good, right, or suitable

prolong.英释: to deliberately make something such as a feeling or an activity last longer

tension.英释: a nervous worried feeling that makes it impossible for you to relax

pursuit.英释: when someone tries to get, achieve, or find something in a determined way

handgun.英释: a small gun that you hold in one hand when you fire it

address.英释: if you address a problem, you start trying to solve it

dignity.英释: the ability to behave in a calm controlled way even in a difficult situation

optimum.英释: the best or most suitable for a particular purpose or in a particular situation

charter.英释: to pay a company for the use of their aircraft, boat etc

overall.英释: You use overall to indicate that you are talking about a situation in general or about the whole of something

conceit.英释: an attitude that shows you have too high an opinion of your own abilities or importance

storage.英释: the process of keeping or putting something in a special place while it is not being used

preside.英释: to be in charge of a formal event, organization, ceremony etc

wrinkle.英释: if you wrinkle a part of your face, or if it wrinkles, small lines appear on it

ambient.英释: relating to the surrounding area; on all sides

neutron.英释: a part of an atom that has no electrical charge

notable.英释: important, interesting, excellent, or unusual enough to be noticed or mentioned

bearing.中释: 方位；（机器的）承座；轴承；忍受
bearing.英释: a direction or angle that is shown by a  compass

cherish.英释: to love someone or something very much and take care of them well

tensile.英释: able to be stretched without breaking

warfare.英释: the activity of fighting in a war – used especially when talking about particular methods of fighting

viscous.英释: (of a liquid 液体) thick and sticky; not flowing freely

further.英释: to help something progress or be successful

glorify.英释: to praise someone or something, especially God

therein.英释: in that place, or in that piece of writing

outside.英释: on or to a place on the outside of sth

freight.英释: goods that are carried by ship, train, or aircraft, and the system of moving these goods

nucleus.英释: The nucleus of an atom or cell is the central part of it.

marshal.英释: an officer of the highest rank in the army or air force of some countries

prophet.英释: a man who people in the Christian, Jewish, or Muslim religion believe has been sent by God to lead them and teach them their religion

foresee.英释: to think or know that something is going to happen in the future

torpedo.英释: a long narrow weapon that is fired under the surface of the sea and explodes when it hits something

shadowy.英释: full of shadows, or difficult to see because of shadows

uranium.英释: a heavy white metal that is radioactive and is used to produce nuclear power and nuclear weapons. It is a chemical element: symbol U

eternal.英释: continuing for ever and having no end

printer.英释: someone who is employed in the trade of printing

harbour.中释: 怀着（不好的想法、恐惧或希望）；包含，藏有；窝藏
harbour.英释: to keep bad thoughts, fears, or hopes in your mind for a long time

obscure.英释: not well known and usually not very important

forsake.英释: to leave someone, especially when you should stay because they need you

concert.英释: people who do something in concert do it together after having agreed on it

episode.中释: （人生的）一段经历；（小说的）片段，插曲
episode.英释: an event, a situation, or a period of time in sb's life, a novel, etc. that is important or interesting in some way

cluster.英释: to come together in a small group or groups

burglar.英释: someone who goes into houses, shops etc to steal things

amateur.英释: someone who does an activity just for pleasure, not as their job

oxidize.英释: to combine with oxygen, or make something combine with oxygen, especially in a way that causes rust

balcony.英释: a structure that you can stand on, that is attached to the outside wall of a building, above ground level

proverb.英释: a short well-known statement that gives advice or expresses something that is generally true. ‘A penny saved is a penny earned’ is an example of a proverb.

banquet.英释: a formal dinner for many people on an important occasion

sharply.英释: in a critical, rough or severe way

dentist.英释: someone whose job is to treat people’s teeth

squeeze.英释: to get liquid from something by pressing it

radiant.英释: full of happiness and love, in a way that shows in your face and makes you look attractive

warrant.中释: （法院授权警方采取行动的）令状；许可证
warrant.英释: a legal document that is signed by a judge, allowing the police to take a particular action

pacific.英释: peaceful and loving or wanting peace

novelty.英释: the quality of being new, unusual, and interesting

vicious.英释: very unkind in a way that is intended to hurt someone’s feelings or make their character seem bad

caution.英释: to warn someone that something might be dangerous, difficult etc

decimal.英释: a decimal system is based on the number 10

forward.英释: to send letters, goods etc to someone when they have moved to a different address

pilgrim.英释: a religious person who travels a long way to a holy place

incense.英释: a substance that has a pleasant smell when you burn it

analogy.英释: something that seems similar between two situations, processes etc

precede.英释: to happen or exist before something or someone, or to come before something else in a series

theatre.英释: a building or place with a stage where plays and shows are performed

foreign.英释: from or relating to a country that is not your own

violate.英释: to disobey or do something against an official agreement, law, principle etc

towards.英释: money put, saved, or given towards something is used to pay for it

majesty.英释: the impressive and attractive quality that sth has

network.英释: a system of lines, tubes, wires, roads etc that cross each other and are connected to each other

crooked.英释: bent, twisted, or not in a straight line

strange.英释: not familiar because you have not been there before or met the person before

impulse.英释: a sudden strong desire to do something without thinking about whether it is a sensible thing to do

torment.英释: to make someone suffer a lot, especially mentally

dessert.英释: sweet food served after the main part of a meal

finance.英释: to provide money, especially a lot of money, to pay for something

nourish.英释: to give a person or other living thing the food and other substances they need in order to live, grow, and stay healthy

thereof.英释: relating to something that has just been mentioned

trivial.英释: not important or serious; not worth considering

laundry.英释: clothes, sheets etc that need to be washed or have just been washed

replace.英释: to put something back where it was before

loosely.英释: in a way that is not firm or tight

observe.英释: to say or write what you have noticed about a situation

buffalo.英释: an African animal similar to a large cow with long curved horns

wrestle.英释: the act or about of wrestling

trolley.英释: a large basket on wheels that you use for carrying bags, shopping etc

fitting.英释: an outside part of a piece of equipment that makes it possible to use or handle it

fitness.英释: the degree to which someone or something is suitable or good enough for a particular situation or purpose

conform.英释: to obey a law, rule etc

freshen.英释: to make something look or feel clean, new, attractive, cool etc

perfect.英释: to make something as good as you are able to

subject.英释: to force a country or group of people to be ruled by you, and control them very strictly

degrade.英释: to treat someone without respect and make them lose respect for themselves

sweeten.英释: to make something sweeter, or become sweeter

thicken.英释: to become thick, or make something thick

develop.英释: to make a photograph out of a photographic film, using chemicals

handout.英释: money or goods that are given to someone, for example because they are poor

ecology.英释: the way in which plants, animals, and people are related to each other and to their environment, or the scientific study of this

mystery.英释: a story, film, or play about a murder, in which you are not told who the murderer is until the end

serpent.英释: a snake, especially a large one

context.英释: the words that come just before and after a word or sentence and that help you understand its meaning

sardine.英释: a small young fish that is often packed in flat metal boxes when it is sold as food

routine.英释: the usual order in which you do things, or the things you regularly do

hostage.英释: someone who is kept as a prisoner by an enemy so that the other side will do what the enemy demands

thermal.英释: relating to or caused by heat

whisker.英释: one of the hairs that grow on a man’s face

extract.英释: a short piece of writing, music etc taken from a particular book, piece of music etc

Jupiter.英释: the planet that is fifth in order from the sun and is the largest in the solar system

section.英释: one of the parts that something such as an object or place is divided into

segment.英释: a part of something that is different from or affected differently from the whole in some way

modesty.英释: the fact of not talking much about your abilities or possessions

utensil.英释: a thing such as a knife, spoon etc that you use when you are cooking

scratch.英释: a small cut on someone’s skin

message.英释: the main or most important idea that someone is trying to tell people about in a film, book, speech etc

implore.英释: to ask for something in an emotional way

terrace.英释: a flat outdoor area next to a building or on a roof, where you can sit outside to eat, relax etc

stagger.英释: to walk or move unsteadily, almost falling over

faction.英释: a small group of people within a larger group, who have different ideas from the other members, and who try to get their own ideas accepted

reptile.英释: a type of animal, such as a snake or lizard , whose body temperature changes according to the temperature around it, and that usually lays eggs to have babies

hostess.英释: a woman who invites guests to a meal, a party, etc.; a woman who has people staying at her home

goddess.英释: a female being who is believed to control the world or part of it, or represents a particular quality

shorten.英释: to become shorter or make something shorter

refugee.英释: someone who has been forced to leave their country, especially during a war, or for political or religious reasons

pumpkin.英释: a very large orange fruit that grows on the ground, or the inside of this fruit

destiny.英释: the things that will happen to someone in the future, especially those that cannot be changed or controlled

classic.英释: admired by many people, and having a value that has continued for a long time

nursery.英释: a place where plants and trees are grown and sold

enchant.英释: to attract sb strongly and make them feel very interested, excited, etc.

perplex.英释: if something perplexes you, it makes you feel confused and worried because it is difficult to understand

cartoon.英释: a short film that is made by photographing a series of drawings

leakage.英释: when gas, water etc leaks in or out, or the amount of it that has leaked

fission.英释: the division of cells into new cells as a method of reproducing cells

ideally.英释: used to describe the way you would like things to be, even though this may not be possible

stammer.英释: a speech problem which makes someone speak with a lot of pauses and repeated sounds

peacock.英释: a large bird, the male of which has long blue and green tail feathers that it can lift up and spread out

spatial.英释: relating to the position, size, shape etc of things

longing.英释: feeling or showing that you want sth very much

whereby.英释: by means of which or according to which

reclaim.英释: to make an area of desert, wet land etc suitable for farming or building

sheriff.英释: the representative of the king or queen in a county of England and Wales, who has mostly ceremonial duties

extinct.英释: (of a type of plant, animal, etc.) no longer in existence

polymer.英释: a chemical compound that has a simple structure of large molecules

whoever.英释: used to mean ‘who’ at the beginning of a question to show surprise or anger

rectify.英释: to correct something that is wrong

contend.英释: to compete against someone in order to gain something

warning.英释: something, especially a statement, that tells you that something bad, dangerous, or annoying might happen so that you can be ready or avoid it

support.英释: to hold the weight of something, keep it in place, or prevent it from falling

prudent.英释: sensible and careful, especially by trying to avoid unnecessary risks

tightly.英释: closely and firmly; in a tight manner

mustard.英释: a yellow sauce with a strong taste, eaten especially with meat

version.英释: a way of explaining or doing something that is typical of a particular group or period of time

reserve.英释: a quality in someone’s character that makes them not like expressing their emotions or talking about their problems

presume.英释: to accept something as being true and base something else on it

poultry.英释: birds such as chickens and ducks that are kept on farms in order to produce eggs and meat

radical.英释: concerning the most basic and important parts of sth; thorough and complete

corrupt.英释: using your power in a dishonest or illegal way in order to get an advantage for yourself

granite.英释: a very hard grey rock, often used in building

applaud.英释: to hit your open hands together, to show that you have enjoyed a play, concert, speaker etc

seaport.英释: a large town on or near a coast, with a harbour that big ships can use

seaside.英释: the areas or towns near the sea, where people go to enjoy themselves

surplus.英释: an amount of something that is more than what is needed or used

orchard.英释: a place where fruit trees are grown

silicon.英释: a chemical substance that exists as a solid or as a powder and is used to make glass, bricks, and parts for computers. It is a chemical element: symbol Si

optical.英释: relating to machines or processes which are concerned with light, images, or the way we see things

inertia.英释: the force that keeps an object in the same position or keeps it moving until it is moved or stopped by another force

monster.英释: an imaginary or ancient creature that is large, ugly, and frightening

antique.英释: a piece of furniture, jewellery etc that was made a very long time ago and is therefore valuable

tribute.英释: something that you say, do, or give in order to express your respect or admiration for someone

mercury.英释: a heavy silver-white poisonous metal that is liquid at ordinary temperatures, and is used in thermometers .It is a chemical element

flavour.英释: to give something a particular taste or more taste

lattice.英释: a pattern or structure made of long pieces of wood, plastic etc that cross each other so that the spaces between them are shaped like diamonds

plateau.英释: a large area of flat land that is higher than the land around it

outline.英释: to describe something in a general way, giving the main points but not the details

summary.英释: giving only the main points of sth, not the details

impress.英释: to press something into a soft surface so that a mark or pattern appears on it

erosion.英释: the process by which rock or soil is gradually destroyed by wind, rain, or the sea

flatter.英释: to praise someone in order to please them or get something from them, even though you do not mean it

shatter.英释: to break suddenly into very small pieces, or to make something break in this way

diverge.英释: to separate and go in different directions

abolish.英释: to officially end a law, system etc, especially one that has existed for a long time

offence.英释: an illegal action or a crime

reactor.英释: a large structure used for the controlled production of nuclear energy

flannel.英释: soft cloth, usually made of cotton or wool, used for making clothes

invoice.英释: a list of goods that have been supplied or work that has been done, showing how much you owe for them

dioxide.英释: a chemical compound that contains two atoms of oxygen and one atom of another chemical element

whereas.英释: used to say that although something is true of one thing, it is not true of another

fighter.英释: a small fast military plane that can destroy other planes

insight.英释: the ability to understand and realize what people or situations are really like

theorem.英释: a statement, especially in mathematics, that you can prove by showing that it has been correctly developed from facts

whisper.英释: to speak or say something very quietly, using your breath rather than your voice

between.英释: in the space or period of time separating two or more points, objects, etc. or two dates, events, etc.

algebra.英释: a type of mathematics that uses letters and other signs to represent numbers and values

gorilla.英释: a very large African monkey that is the largest of the apes

embassy.英释: a group of officials who represent their government in a foreign country, or the building they work in

prairie.英释: a wide open area of fairly flat land in North America which is covered in grass or wheat

lighter.英释: a small object that produces a flame for lighting cigarettes etc

fragile.英释: weak and uncertain; easily destroyed or spoilt

romance.英释: a story that has brave characters and exciting events

leaflet.英释: a small book or piece of paper advertising something or giving information on a particular subject

antenna.英释: one of two long thin parts on an insect’s head, that it uses to feel things

equator.英释: an imaginary line drawn around the middle of the Earth that is exactly the same distance from the North Pole and the South Pole

persist.英释: if something bad persists, it continues to exist or happen

commend.英释: to praise or approve of someone or something publicly

immerse.英释: to become or make sb completely involved in sth

horizon.英释: the line far away where the land or sea seems to meet the sky

tactics.英释: the art and science of the detailed direction and control of movement or manoeuvre of forces in battle to achieve an aim or task

cruelty.英释: behaviour or actions that deliberately cause pain to people or animals

senator.英释: a member of the Senate or a senate

invalid.英释: someone who cannot look after themselves because of illness, old age, or injury

heading.英释: the title written at the beginning of a piece of writing, or at the beginning of part of a book

diploma.英释: a document showing that a student has successfully completed their high school or university education

bandage.英释: a narrow piece of cloth that you tie around a wound or around a part of the body that has been injured

essence.英释: the most basic and important quality of something

captive.英释: kept in prison or in a place that you are not allowed to leave

panther.英释: a large wild animal that is black and a member of the cat family

leopard.英释: a large animal of the cat family, with yellow fur and black spots, which lives in Africa and South Asia

grumble.英释: to keep complaining in an unhappy way

shutter.英释: one of a pair of wooden or metal covers on the outside of a window that can be closed to keep light out or prevent thieves from coming in

flatten.英释: to make something flat or flatter, or to become flat or flatter

ascribe.英释: to claim that something is caused by a particular person, situation etc

haughty.英释: behaving in a proud unfriendly way

patriot.英释: someone who loves their country and is willing to defend it – used to show approval

referee.英释: someone who makes sure that the rules of a sport such as football, basketball , or boxing , are followed

eclipse.英释: an occasion when the sun or the moon cannot be seen, because the Earth is passing directly between the moon and the sun, or because the moon is passing directly between the Earth and the sun

flutter.英释: if a bird or insect flutters, or if it flutters its wings, it flies by moving its wings lightly up and down

pyjamas.英释: a soft pair of trousers and a top that you wear in bed

fertile.英释: (of a person's mind or imagination) that produces a lot of new ideas

slander.英释: to say false things about someone in order to damage other people’s good opinion of them

tighten.英释: to close or fasten something firmly by turning it

deflect.英释: to change direction or make sth change direction, especially after hitting sth

revolve.英释: to move around like a wheel, or to make something move around like a wheel

default.英释: to not do something that you are supposed to do, especially that you are legally supposed to do

broaden.英释: to make something wider, or to become wider

entreat.英释: to ask someone, in a very emotional way, to do something for you

chatter.英释: continuous rapid talk about things that are not important

boycott.英释: an act of boycotting something, or the period of time when it is boycotted

counter.英释: to be the opposite of something
